messages.message:
We used to have that feature. However it's a really slow implementation to move a folder stored in S3 to a Trash folder so we removed that feature.

Maybe @Heymian or others on the infra team can consider a feature we would want to add there. Currently we do version our S3 bucket.

I think the bigger solution is to create a snapshot of the data so we can recover it
We shouldn't do things just for S3
we should think a way so that it works for the Instabase Filesystem
regardless of the mounted storage underneath
Generally speaking I agree with you. In the acute problem that we have on instabase.com (http://instabase.com), we need to do some backup of assets there
